summary: This document contains due diligence research results for NES, LLC, including various compliance checks and media results. It highlights a federal contract awarded to NES, LLC and details financial agreements related to the company's restructuring and issuance of new notes. The document emphasizes the importance of compliance and thorough review of results for clients. This document outlines various corporate actions taken by the Company, including the resignation and appointment of directors, the issuance of new shares and warrants, and amendments to the bylaws. It details the financial implications of these actions, including compliance with Nasdaq listing rules and the restructuring of the Company's equity. This document contains various exhibits related to the financial and corporate structure of SAExploration Holdings, Inc., including amendments to its certificate of incorporation, bylaws, and various agreements dated July 27, 2016. It highlights the company's financial dealings and organizational changes, which may be relevant to ongoing investigations. This document appears to be a business profile for a shoe store owned by Sang Park, detailing its legal status, employee count, and industry classification. There are no significant legal findings or court cases mentioned.

events.title: Federal Contract Awarded to NES, LLC
events.description: NES, LLC was awarded a federal contract for the installation of lightning protection systems and surge protection devices.

events.title: Restructuring Support Agreement
events.description: SAExploration Holdings, Inc. entered into a comprehensive restructuring support agreement with holders of its Senior Secured Notes.

events.title: Exchange Offer Completion
events.description: SAExploration Holdings, Inc. completed its exchange offer related to its Existing Notes.

events.title: Resignation of Directors
events.description: Several directors, including Gregory R. Monahan, Eric S. Rosenfeld, David D. Sgro, and Brent Whiteley, resigned from the Board of Directors.

events.title: Appointment of New Directors
events.description: L. Melvin Cooper, Michael Kass, and Jacob Mercer were appointed as new directors of the Company.

events.title: Indemnification Agreements
events.description: The Company entered into indemnification agreements with several individuals, including new directors and existing officers.

events.title: Reverse Stock Split
events.description: The Company executed a reverse stock split at a ratio of 135-to-1, effective July 26, 2016.

events.title: Indenture Agreement
events.description: An indenture agreement was executed among SAExploration Holdings, Inc. and various guarantors, detailing financial obligations.

events.title: Document Signing
events.description: The document was signed by Brent Whiteley on behalf of SAExploration Holdings, Inc.

keyFacts: NES, LLC won a federal contract worth $128,278 from the Alabama Air National Guard.
The document includes compliance checks for NES, LLC with no negative media results found.
SAExploration Holdings, Inc. entered into a restructuring support agreement on June 13, 2016.
The company completed an exchange offer for its Existing Notes on July 27, 2016.
The document emphasizes the need for compliance review and clearance for alerts.
The Company provided notice to Nasdaq regarding non-compliance with audit committee composition due to director resignations.
The Company issued 2,803,302 shares of common stock to lenders under a New Senior Loan Facility.
The New Notes Shares and New Senior Loan Shares represent 98.6% of the Company's outstanding shares as of July 27, 2016.
The Company entered into indemnification agreements with several individuals, including new directors and existing officers.
A reverse stock split was executed at a ratio of 135-to-1 on July 26, 2016.
Brent Whiteley signed the document as Chief Financial Officer and General Counsel of SAExploration Holdings, Inc.
Evan Makovsky served as the registered agent for NES, LLC from May 30, 2007, to May 31, 2017.
Sang Park is associated with NES, LLC as a member.
The document includes various financial agreements dated July 27, 2016, relevant to SAExploration Holdings, Inc.
The document was created on August 1, 2016, and is marked as confidential.
The business was founded in 2004 and operates as a proprietorship.
The company has a total of 2 actual employees.
The business is classified under SIC code 5661, which pertains to retail shoe stores.
No court cases or legal issues were found related to this business.
